DOC.brief_summary: This study include patient age 18 70 undergo retrograde intrarenal surgery ( RIRS ) due renal stone ( ) . A total 80 patient ( male female ) recruit , randomize 2 group consist 40 patient group . The first group patient undergo RIRS ureteral access sheath ( UAS ) position prior surgery ; second group undergo RIRS without UAS . As use UAS decrease pressure renal pelvis RIRS , aim evaluate whether use UAS affect level pain felt patient postoperative period .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Ureteral Access Sheath Use Postoperative Pain Level Patients Undergoing RIRS
DOC.detailed_description: The level pain patient group evaluate use visual analog score ( VAS ) verbal rating score ( VRS ) postoperative 0 min ( moment patient get consciousness he/she wake general anesthesia ) , 10th min , 30th min , 60th min 120th min .
DOC.criteria: Being 1870 year old Having indication retrograde infrarenal surgery ( RIRS ) due kidney stone Patients uncontrolled diabetes mellitus diabetic nephropathy Patients blood pressure > 140/80 mmHg despite regular use antihypertensive agent ( ) Patients chronic kidney failure need dialysis Patients prerenal , renal postrenal acute kidney failure 3 month much early Patients pyelonephritis 3 month much early Patients young 18 year old 70 year Patients undergone kidney surgery within last 3 month abnormal kidney function test Patients concomitant ureter stone undergo endoscopic ureter stone treatment session Patients use kind medication affect his/her perception pain
